data.title: A History of Indian Philosophy, Vol. I
data.meta_description: A history of Indian Philosophy Vol I written by Surendranath Dasgupta was published in the year 1951. The books offers in-depth knowledge about the Vedas, Brahmanas and their philosophy. It also gives an insight into the Upanishads and makes general observations about the system of Indian Philosophy. Other areas explored by the author are Buddhist philosophy, the Jaina philosophy, the Kapila and the Patanjala samkhya, the Nyaya Vaisesika philosophy, Mimamsa philosophy and the Sankara school of Vedanta.
data.text:
Author: Dasgupta, Surendranath

Keywords: Philosophy

History

Spiritual Life

Hindu Way of Living- India

Publisher: University Press, Cambridge

Description: A history of Indian Philosophy Vol I written by Surendranath Dasgupta was published in the year 1951. The books offers in-depth knowledge about the Vedas, Brahmanas and their philosophy. It also gives an insight into the Upanishads and makes general observations about the system of Indian Philosophy. Other areas explored by the author are Buddhist philosophy, the Jaina philosophy, the Kapila and the Patanjala samkhya, the Nyaya Vaisesika philosophy, Mimamsa philosophy and the Sankara school of Vedanta.

Source: Central Secretariat Library

Type: E-Book
